title: Why only female Darwin’s bark spiders weave the toughest webs
description: The Darwin’s bark spider, found in the forests of Madagascar, weaves silk that outperforms steel and most human-made fibres in both strength and toughness. Its silk has a tensile strength of about 1.6 gigapascals, around 3x higher than that of iron, making it the toughest biological material ever tested

Modi declared Nabin his "boss" in party matters, commending his performance in all roles. He urged party members to learn from the Congress's past mistakes as the BJP solidifies its position as the nation's preferred governing party across all levels.

The uncertainty follows Bangladesh rejecting ICC conditions to play in India, amid an unresolved venue dispute and a looming February 7 tournament start.

This move aims to boost discipline and productivity in legislative proceedings.

title: 'Very excited': Second lady Usha Vance announces pregnancy; Vances to welcome fourth child

This marks a significant moment as she is the first vice presidential spouse to be pregnant while her husband is in office. The couple expressed gratitude for their support system.

title: Government advises kin of Indian officials in Bangladesh to return
description: In response to escalating anti-India protests and potential violence in Bangladesh, India has advised families of its diplomats and officials stationed there to return home. This precautionary measure aims to ensure safety, though all Indian missions and posts in Bangladesh remain fully operational. The situation is temporary and will be reassessed.

title: Monkey pox strain links Kerala cases to foreign travel: Study
description: A groundbreaking genetic study in Kerala has identified a more aggressive Mpox variant, Clade Ib, linked to international travel and ongoing human-to-human spread. Researchers found distinct mutations indicating the virus is evolving and adapting, suggesting faster transmission than older strains. This discovery underscores the urgent need for heightened surveillance and public health preparedness across India.

description: Tech titan Peter Thiel has injected $3 million into a California group opposing a proposed 5% wealth tax on billionaires. This one-time tax targets California residents with assets exceeding $1 billion. The move signals a significant early financial backing for the campaign against the "2026 Billionaire Tax Act," with other tech leaders also expressing concerns and considering relocation.

Suniel Shetty speaks on Hindi Marathi language row gives strong view
description: Suniel Shetty weighed in on the Hindi-Marathi language debate in Maharashtra, questioning the mandatory imposition of Hindi. He emphasized that while Mumbai is his karmabhoomi, he will learn Marathi willingly, not under compulsion, stating his personal connection to his roots remains strong.

title: Newton vs Leibniz: The calculus war classrooms never teach
description: Calculus was not born in a classroom, it was born in a fight. Isaac Newton developed fluxions in private during the plague years, while Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz published first in Acta Eruditorum and gave calculus its travelling notation. When pride entered, mathematics turned into a custody battle.

title: ‘Prabhas is like a 5 year old, his intentions are that pure,’ says The Raja Saab co-star Nidhhi Agerwal: ‘No politics no PR, he isn’t like that’
Provocateur-in-chief: How Trump's leadership differs from Obama, Reagan, or Nixon
description: That reaction itself is revealing. Trump does not see the presidency as a role shaped by inheritance, restraint, or continuity. He sees it as a personal contest, one in which dominance, visibility, and disruption are the metrics of success. To compare him with earlier presidents is therefore not just an academic exercise. It is a way of understanding how radically his leadership style departs from the American tradition.

title: Indore water crisis: High Court asks how contamination became so severe that it ‘proved fatal to human life’
'Kahan aim kar rahe ho?' Gambhir asks Pandya; what came next shocked everyone - watch
description: Hardik Pandya is set to return for India in the T20I series against New Zealand after recovering from injury. A net session video showed Pandya's powerful hitting, drawing humorous reactions from coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Suryakumar Yadav. Pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah also returns, bolstering the squad.

description: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said Ishan Kishan will bat at No. 3 ahead of Shreyas Iyer in the New Zealand T20 series as he is part of India’s T20 World Cup squad and a like-for-like replacement for injured Tilak Varma. Iyer will be considered at No. 5. Suryakumar stressed flexibility in batting roles and prioritised team success over individual form.

As Indiana’s Heisman-winning quarterback chased a national title, his mom’s long battle with multiple sclerosis shaped his mindset, motivation, and purpose. Here’s why Mendoza keeps pointing back to her during the biggest run of his career.

description: Donald Trump's second term has been a whirlwind of activity. He has commanded global attention through bold policies and a 'America First' approach.  Tariffs, military actions, and ambitious territorial proposals have reshaped international relations.  His administration has also implemented strict immigration policies.  This era marks a significant shift in global dynamics.

From building brands to investing in rare collectibles, Paul emphasizes adaptability, calculated risk, and surrounding yourself with the right people. His advice encourages young professionals to turn interests into careers and embrace unconventional paths to success.

Delhi pollution: GRAP IV restrictions revoked; decision after slight improvement
description: Delhi-NCR's air quality has seen improvement, leading the Commission for Air Quality Management to revoke GRAP-IV restrictions just three days after their re-imposition. While the 'severe+' category triggered the ban, stages I, II, and III of GRAP remain active.  This move offers some relief from the stringent pollution control measures.

description: Music maestro AR Rahman sparked debate with comments on Bollywood's alleged communal shift and calling 'Chhaava' divisive. Amidst online backlash, his children, Ameen, Khatija, and Raheema, rallied in support, highlighting his global achievements and integrity. Rahman clarified his views on the film and his career trajectory.

description: Madras High Court reserved its order on the 'Jana Nayagan' censorship row after a five-hour hearing. The court examined if the CBFC followed procedures when issuing and withdrawing film certification. Arguments focused on whether producers had adequate response time and if the board could revoke an initial decision. The outcome awaits the court's decision.

description: Speculation over the Karnataka chief minister post continues. DK Shivakumar's brother said that Rahul Gandhi assured a decision would be made  at an "appropriate time". Shivakumar is reportedly exercising restraint for party unity. The upcoming legislative session may offer clarity. Meanwhile, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah remains open to discussions in New Delhi.

Gates Foundation investments: Fossil fuel holdings hit $254m; raises climate questions
description: The Gates Foundation Trust has increased its investments in fossil fuel companies, holding $254 million in extractors like Chevron, BP, and Shell. This marks a nine-year high and contradicts Bill Gates' past claims of divestment, despite his skepticism about its effectiveness in combating climate change.

title: Stray dogs order: SC criticises Maneka Gandhi's remarks; and makes a 'Kasab' reference
'Great stupidity': After Greenland, Trump eyes Diego Garcia; why it matters to India
description: President Trump's criticism of the UK potentially returning Diego Garcia to Mauritius, a move backed by India, has escalated. This island hosts a vital US military base. India, with its own security interests in the Indian Ocean and historical ties to Mauritius, is supporting the decolonization process, offering significant aid for the archipelago's development.

title: Sulaiman Khan Ghori exit: Engineer leaves xAI after podcast; sparks firing speculation
description: Former xAI engineer Sulaiman Khan Ghori has departed the company, sparking speculation he was "fired" for being "too candid" during a podcast interview. Ghori discussed xAI's rapid development, novel architectures like "Macro Hard," and innovative deployment strategies, including using Tesla computers for "human emulators."

title: John Harbaugh’s wife Ingrid turns heads during Giants’ headline-making entrance
description: John Harbaugh’s arrival marks a defining shift for the New York Giants as the franchise embraces experience and stability. After nearly two decades in Baltimore, Harbaugh steps into New York with renewed purpose, supported by his family and a young, promising roster, fueling optimism about a disciplined rebuild and a competitive future.

title: Matthew Stafford’s family turns heads in Chicago with matching Rams style
description: Matthew Stafford and the Los Angeles Rams braved snowy Chicago for an NFC clash against the Bears. Despite an MVP-worthy season with 4,707 yards and 46 touchdowns, Stafford has never won the award. His wife Kelly and their four daughters cheered him on in matching custom Rams jackets, highlighting their family support as Stafford pursues his second Super Bowl in his 17th NFL season.

title: Shane Lowry’s net worth: The relentless rise of Ireland’s major champion
description: Shane Lowry's career is a testament to hard work, patience, and clutch performances. From an amateur Irish Open win to lifting The Open Championship trophy, he has become a reliable force on both the PGA Tour and DP World Tour. His consistent success, including recent strong showings and a record-tying 62, underscores his enduring talent and dedication.
